    • Method Detail

      • run

        public java.lang.Object run(java.lang.Object... args)
        Function that runs the probabilistic program. In our case, we call the MATLAB JMI library's eval function. This is calls (in MATLAB) eval("(chimplify_internal_args{:})") which is the same as (again, in MATLAB) (arg1, arg2, ..., argN) and sets the return value to lastresult, a local variable that MatlabMetropolisHastingsSolver will later add to chimplify_internal_results. If something goes wrong, JMI will throw a MatlabException (which we will re-throw so that it shows up in the MATLAB console). Unfortunately, the MATLAB console error dump will not tell you what line the MATLAB error is on, so debugging your probabilistic program may be annoying. To circumvent this, test your probabilistic program by directly calling (in MATLAB) (, ..., ) instead of solver.solve() until you have fixed all of your bugs.
        Specified by:
        run in class ChimpleProgram
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments (ignored)
        Returns:
        r A placeholder (the results never actually cross the MATLAB-Java membrane)
